item.description:
Anyone who is available on Saturday December 16th is invited to join together for a bit of holiday/yule/solstice cheer while seeing a living breathing permaculture home at the same time!

* Note that space is limited so it's important to RSVP at this site as soon as you are able ... Thanks! *

Charles & Julia Yelton welcome us to their very own Humastacia Permaculture Gardens (less active in December...but still very wonderful) for a potluck lunch followed by a brief discussion of cosmology (an area of interest for them which forms some of the underpinnings for their approach to permaculture) and then a tour of the home inside and out. This event will offer something for the strictly practical-minded amongst us as well as for those interested in the "connectedness of all things" as we write our own stories of sustainability into the future.

WHAT TO BRING: A dish/beverage/snack to share. Comfy warm clothes for the outside part of the tour and/or hanging out near the outdoor bread oven (which will be fired up that day). Optional: A written intention for the new year (for your eyes only:) that we can send up in the firing of the oven.

CARPOOLING: Anyone who would like to carpool from Portland is encouraged to meet at the Marginal Way Park-and-Ride lot (Next to Franklin Arterial and across from Bally Total Fitness; NOT across from Wild Oats) at 10:00 am on 12/16. We will organize ourselves into the fewest number of vehicles and leave by 10:15 am.

Anyone not carpooling with us can meet us there at 11:30.

group.name: Portland Maine Permaculture & The Resilience Hub

item.name: Holiday Potluck Lunch & Permaculture Tour of Yeltons' Home
